title: What Does 'Vro' Mean? The Popular Online Term Explained

steps.title: â€œVroâ€ stands for Very Rare Only and is used in place of bro.
steps.content: â€œVroâ€ stands for Very Rare Only and is used in place of bro. When it first became popular, â€œvroâ€ was used unironically as another word for â€œbro.â€ In late 2023, however, it became a term that was used ironically on TikTok. Users usually use the term in comments, stylized as â€œğ“—ğ“®ğ“µğ“µğ“¸ ğ“¥ğ“»ğ“¸ â¤ï¸,â€ to ironically greet other users. The term is also used in memes with photos of cute animals or regular people being captioned with â€œHello Vroâ€ accompanied by a heart. [1] X Research source Very Rare Only refers to XXXTentacion and Ski Mask The Slump Godâ€™s music collective of the same name. In other contexts, VRO stands for Value Realization Office. A Value Realization Office oversees Value Realization, which is the ability to measure how people and projects directly impact large business objectives, specifically objectives that are executive-level. [2] X Research source

steps.title: â€œVroâ€ was popularized by late rapper XXXTentacion in 2015.
steps.content: â€œVroâ€ was popularized by late rapper XXXTentacion in 2015. In his track â€œLook at Me,â€ the rapper sings a line that reads, â€œshe kick me out Iâ€™m like Vro.â€ After the track went viral on Soundcloud, fans incorporated the term into their vocabulary. Fans often used it to identify fellow XXXTentacion and Ski Mask The Slump God listeners. â€œVroâ€ has since been used in place of â€œbroâ€ by hardcore XXXTentacion fans, but it is also used in an ironic way by various people on the internet.

steps.title: Use â€œvroâ€ to refer to a friend you care aboutâ€”but in an ironic way.
steps.content: Use â€œvroâ€ to refer to a friend you care aboutâ€”but in an ironic way. While â€œvroâ€ is a term of endearment, its outdatedness and TikTok virality have caused it to be a term that is best used ironically. Using it regularly runs the risk of people looking at you like an XXXTentacion super-fan! So, to get a laugh out of your friend or annoy them with an unserious greeting, text them â€œgood morning vroâ€ with a heart. Make sure to include the heart (or a winky face ) so they know youâ€™re being ironic. Be careful when using this term with people that you donâ€™t know. Even if you use it ironically, people may think that youâ€™re unfunny. [3] X Research source If you are a hardcore fan of XXXTentacion or Ski Mask The Slump God and want to communicate with other fans, use â€œvroâ€ in place of â€œbroâ€ in a sincere way. For example, when discussing their discographies with fellow fans online, say â€œYooo vro, whatâ€™s your favorite X and Ski collab?â€

steps.title: Broski
steps.content: Broski Broski is a slang term used to casually refer to a friend or fellow person. It is a variation of the word brother and is a more relaxed way of saying bro. It isnâ€™t as popular as bro, but the two terms are used interchangeably. You can use broski in place of dude, as well. It can also be spelled as broskie or brosky. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Fam
steps.content: Fam Fam is short for family. It is used to refer to family, friends, and other close people in your life. The term gained popularity in 1990, often being used in hip-hop. It was initially only used to refer to your family, but as time has gone on, it has been used to refer to individuals or multiple people. [5] X Research source To avoid the potential embarrassment of using the word vro, use fam to refer to your friends.

steps.title: Bookie
steps.content: Bookie Bookie has had various meanings over time, but on TikTok, it is used as a term of love and endearment. It is often used in place of boo, sweety, or baby and serves as a cute pet name for someone you like. If a girl uses the word bookie, she definitely likes you. She might also call you â€œbookie pookie,â€ â€œpookie,â€ or â€œpooh bearâ€ if she likes you. [6] X Research source
